name: Shark Jaws
climate: Shark Jaws thrive in a desert-like climate with low humidity and dryness.
They prefer a warm environment, ideally between 60°F and 75°F.
This plant can tolerate occasional temperature drops but not frost.
Constant humid environments are not ideal; they prefer dry air.
sunlight: Shark Jaws require full sunlight to maintain their vibrant colors.
A south-facing window is ideal for maximum sun exposure each day.
If grown indoors, placing them near a sunny window is recommended.
They can tolerate some partial shade but may lose vibrant colors.
watering: Allow the soil to dry out completely between watering sessions.
During the summer, water them less frequently to prevent rot.
In winter, reduce watering significantly as they are dormant.
Overwatering can cause root rot, which is a serious issue for them.
soil: Use well-draining cactus or succulent soil for Shark Jaws.
A gritty mix of sand, perlite, and potting soil works well.
Avoid heavy soils that retain too much moisture for long.
Ensuring good drainage will help simulate their natural habitat.
toxic: Shark Jaws are not considered toxic, making them pet friendly.
extra_care_tip: Keep them away from regions with frost or extreme cold conditions.
Repot them every couple of years to refresh the soil nutrients.
Protect from pests like mealybugs, aphids, or spider mites.
Fertilize sparingly during growing season for best results.
